name: mu Leo
scenarioDescription:
The mu Leo Exoplanetary System


Overview

mu Leo is a star with 1.5 times the mass of the Sun, and 11.4 times its radius. It is located 106.42 light years away from the solar system and is estimated to be 3.35 billion years old, as compared to the Sun which is roughly 4.6 billion years old.

mu Leo is known to have 1 exoplanets in orbit around it.


Exoplanets in the mu Leo system


mu Leo b

mu Leo b was discovered by the Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory observatory using the radial velocity method. Its semi-major axis is 1.10 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. The mass of mu Leo b is 763.1999999999999 times the mass of Earth. At more than 50 Earth masses, mu Leo b is a gas giant, a planet whose mass is mostly made up of hydrogen and helium, like Jupiter and Saturn in our solar system.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system mu Leo, which contains 1 planets and was discovered by Bohyunsan Optical Astronomical Observatory.
